author: maxb
msg: Collect all SWIG backward compatibility definitions littered throughout the
bindings into a new file.  Tested to not change the generated code with
[in subversion/bindings/swig/]
* core.i, include/apr.swg, include/svn_types.swg:
Move backward compatibility definitions...
* include/svn_swigcompat.swg: ...to this new file.
* include/svn_global.swg: Include svn_swigcompat.swg.

author: maxb
msg: Ruby nowarn pragma is not related to APR, so it should not be in apr.swg -
move it.
[in subversion/bindings/swig/]
* include/apr.swg: Move Ruby nowarn pragma from here...
* include/svn_global.swg: ...to here, improving comment.

author: maxb
msg: Remove the 'auto dependency %include' feature from the Python SWIG bindings.
I do not know why it was added - it seems unnecessary, and was causing us
to unintentionally wrap more than we intended to wrap.
* build/generator/swig/header_wrappers.py (_write_includes):
Stop generating '%include *_h.swg' lines in generated *_h.swg files.
Additionally, lose the '%import apr.swg' and '%import proxy.swg' - there
is no point doing this in generated files when it these can be trivially
included globally.
* subversion/bindings/swig/svn_client.i: Remove kludge that is no longer
necessary, now that the above is done.
* subversion/bindings/swig/include/svn_global.swg:
Add %include of proxy.swg (apr.swg is already %included).

author: maxb
msg: Further include order cleanup in the SWIG bindings producing massive churn in
the generated code, especially for Python).
[in subversion/bindings/swig/]
* core.i: Do not include svn_types.swg here.
Move includes of svn_error_codes_h.swg, svn_time_h.swg and svn_types_h.swg
down to join the rest (which is what causes the churn - lots of stuff is
now seeing more typemaps than it did before).
* include/svn_global.swg: Include svn_types.swg, and copyright and description
updates.

author: maxb
msg: Tiny change to SWIG include ordering which produces a HUGE change in the
generated code for the Python wrappers.  Made in a separate commit for ease
of traceability in case this has unexpected effects.
[in subversion/bindings/swig/]
* core.i: Move the %include of svn_types.swg further up in the file.
Functions in svn_error_codes.h, svn_props.h, svn_string.h and svn_types.h
were being wrapped without the influence of the majority of the
Subversion typemaps, which seems wrong to me.
